metadata.Title: CVE-2022-40898 on Ubuntu 22.10 (kinetic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
An issue discovered in Python Packaging Authority (PyPA) Wheel 0.37.1 and earlier allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service via attacker controlled input to wheel cli.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-40898` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

python3-pip - 22.2+dfsg-1ubuntu0.2
python3-pip-whl - 22.2+dfsg-1ubuntu0.2
No subscription required

python-wheel-common - 0.37.1-2ubuntu0.22.10.1
python3-wheel - 0.37.1-2ubuntu0.22.10.1
python3-wheel-whl - 0.37.1-2ubuntu0.22.10.1
No subscription required

notes.Note: mdeslaur> the python-pip package bundles wheel binaries when built. After updating wheel, a no-change rebuild of python-pip is required.

criterions.comment: python-pip package in kinetic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '22.2+dfsg-1ubuntu0.2').
wheel package in kinetic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.37.1-2ubuntu0.22.10.1').
